intro: Gynoxys cusilluyocana, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Gynoxys cusilluyocana is adapted to cold, dry climates and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native environment.
